00041 def assertAcknowledgmentPresent(self, tcp):
00042     """RFC??
00043        ...ack must be present in every packet since step #2 of 3wayhand
00044     """
00045     self.failUnless(tcp.ack_number != None and tcp.ack_number > 0, \
00046         'ack number must be present and greater then 0') 
00047 
00048 def assertSynPresent(self, tcp):
00049     """
00050     """
00051     self.failIf(tcp.syn < 1, \
00052         "we expect the segment must have SYN bit set")
00053     assertSequencePresent(self, tcp)
00054 
00055 def assertSequencePresent(self, tcp):
00056     """RFC793-P24-p1
00057        A fundamental notion in the design is that every octet of data sent
00058     over a TCP connection has a sequence number.
00059     """
00060     self.failUnless(tcp.sequence != None and tcp.sequence > 0, \
00061         'sequence must be present and greater then 0') 
00062 
00063 def assertExpectedSequence(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00064     """RFC??
00065     """
00066     self.assertEqual(tcp.sequence, tcb.tcpsequence[ to ], \
00067         'sequence: ' + str(tcp.sequence) + ' , but we expect: ' + str(tcb.tcpsequence[ to ]) )
00068     
00069 def assertExpectedAcknowledgment(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00070     """RFC793-P16-p2
00071     Acknowledgment Number, value of the next sequence number the sender of
00072     the segment is expecting to receive
00073     """
00074     self.assertEqual(tcp.ack_number, tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ], \
00075         'ack number: ' + str(tcp.ack_number) + ' , but we expect: ' + str(tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ]) )
00076 
00077 def assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to):
00078     #RFC793-P24-p1
00079     assertSequencePresent(self, tcp)
00080     #RFC TODO
00081     assertAcknowledgmentPresent(self, tcp)
00082     #RFC793-P16-p2
00083     assertExpectedAcknowledgment(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to)
00084     #RFC TODO
00085     assertExpectedSequence(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to)
00086

00088 def assertReset(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to, tcp_sent):
00089     """
00090         RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00091         Page 36
00092 
00093         If the incoming segment has an ACK field, the reset takes its
00094         sequence number from the ACK field of the segment, otherwise the
00095         reset has sequence number zero and the ACK field is set to the sum
00096         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment.
00097         The connection remains in the CLOSED state.
00098     """
00099     #it must be a reset
00100     self.failIf(tcp.reset <1, 'reset bit must be set') 
00101 
00102     if (tcp_sent.ack_number == None or tcp_sent.ack_number == 0):
00103     #Assuming that "incoming segment" has *NO* ACK Field we need assert that:
00104         #(1)has sequence number zero
00105         self.assertEqual(tcp.sequence, 0, \
00106             'The incoming segment has no ack, then the reset segment we expect must have sequence equal to zero')
00107 
00108         #(2)ACK field set to the sum of the sequence number and segment length
00109         expected_sum = len(tcp_sent.getbytes()) + tcp_sent.sequence  
00110         self.assertEqual(tcp.ack_number, expected_sum, \
00111             "The incoming segment has no ack, then the reset segment we expect must have ack_number equal to sum of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment. Expected ack_number: " + str(tcp.ack_number) + " given: " + str(expected_sum) )
00112 
00113     else: #(tcp.sent.ack_number > 0): 
00114         #Assuming that "incoming segment" has ACK Field we need assert that:
00115         #(1)sequence number set to the ACK sent (Reset use sequence that receiver waits for)
00116         assertExpectedSequence(self, tcb, tcp, from_, to)
00117  
00118 def assertFin(self, tcp):
00119     """is fin flag on?
00120     """
00121     self.failIf(tcp.fin<1,  \
00122         "we expect the segment must have FIN bit set")

00125 def createsyn(self, tcb, from_, to):
00126     """Create tcp syn flag expertise"""
00127 
00128     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00129 
00130     #business
00131     tcp.syn = 1
00132     tcp.ack = 0
00133     tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ] += 1
00134 
00135     return (ip, tcp)
00136 
00137 def createrstfromreceivedtcp(self, tcb, from_, to, tcp_received):
00138     """Create tcp rst flag expertise"""
00139 
00140     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00141 
00142     #business
00143     if (tcp_received.ack_number == None or tcp_received.ack_number == 0):
00144         #Assuming that "incoming segment" has *NO* ACK Field we need:
00145         #(1)sequence number must be zero
00146         tcp.sequence = 0
00147 
00148         #(2)ACK field must be set to the sum of the sequence number and segment length
00149         calc_sum = len(tcp_received.getbytes()) + tcp_received.sequence  
00150         tcp.ack_number = calc_sum
00151 
00152     else: #(tcp_received.ack_number > 0): 
00153         #Assuming that "incoming segment" has ACK Field we need:
00154         #(1)sequence number must be set to the ACK received (Reset use sequence that receiver waits for)
00155         tcp.sequence   = tcp_received.ack_number
00156         #tcp.ack_number = tcp_received.sequence + 1 (it is not present at rfc)
00157 
00158     return (ip, tcp)
00159 
00160 def createfakerstfromtcb(self, tcb, from_, to):
00161     """Create tcp rst flag expertise"""
00162 
00163     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00164 
00165     #business
00166     if (tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] == None or tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] == 0):
00167         #Assuming that "incoming segment" has *NO* ACK Field we need:
00168         #(1)sequence number must be zero
00169         tcp.sequence = 0
00170 
00171         #(2)ACK field must be set to the sum of the sequence number and segment length
00172         tcp.ack_number = 666 #FAKE'
00173 
00174     else: #(tcp_received.ack_number > 0): 
00175         #Assuming that "incoming segment" has ACK Field we need:
00176         #(1)sequence number must be set to the ACK received (Reset use sequence that receiver waits for)
00177         tcp.sequence   = tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ]
00178         #tcp.ack_number = tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] (it is not present at rfc)
00179 
00180     return (ip, tcp)

00183 def createoutofwindowack(self, tcb, from_, to):
00184     #setting an out of window acknowledgment
00185     tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] += 9000000 #(value greater then window size)
00186 
00187     #avoid overflow
00188     if ( tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] > (1<<32)-1 ):   
00189         tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] -= (1<<32)      #without -1
00190 
00191     return createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00192

00194 def createfin(self, tcb, from_, to):
00195     """Create tcp fin flag expertise"""
00196 
00197     (ip, tcp) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00198 
00199     #business
00200     tcp.fin = 1
00201     tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ] += 1
00202 
00203     return (ip, tcp)

00205 def createip(self, tcb, from_, to):
00206     """Create ip packet
00207     tcp is also created here"""
00208     ip1 = ipv4.ipv4()
00209 
00210     ip1.version = 4 
00211     ip1.hlen = 5   
00212     ip1.tos = 0     
00213     ip1.id = tcb.ipid[ from_ ] 
00214     ip1.flags = 0 
00215     ip1.offset = 0
00216     ip1.ttl = 64
00217     ip1.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00218     ip1.src = tcb.ip[ from_ ]
00219     ip1.dst = tcb.ip[ to ]
00220     ip1.length = len(ip1.bytes)
00221 
00222     # tcp here
00223     tcp1 = createtcp(self, tcb, ip1, from_, to)
00224     
00225     ip1.length = len(ip1.bytes) + len(tcp1.bytes) 
00226     #ip1.checksum = ip_cksum(ip1) #doind this at checkout(createwritepacket)
00227     
00228     return (ip1, tcp1)

00231 def createtcp(self, tcb, ip, from_, to):
00232     """Create tcp packet"""
00233     tcp1 = tcp.tcp()
00234 
00235     tcp1.sport = tcb.tcpport[ from_ ] 
00236     tcp1.dport = tcb.tcpport[ to ]
00237     tcp1.sequence = tcb.tcpsequence[ from_ ]        
00238     tcp1.ack_number = tcb.tcpsequence[ to ]
00239     tcp1.offset = 5
00240     tcp1.urgent = 0
00241     tcp1.ack = 1
00242     tcp1.push = 0
00243     tcp1.reset = 0
00244     tcp1.syn = 0
00245     tcp1.fin = 0
00246     tcp1.window = (1<<16)-1
00247     tcp1.urg_point = 0
00248     #tcp1.options
00249     
00250     #tcp1.checksum = tcp_cksum(tcp1 , ip) #doind this at checkout(createwrite)
00251     return tcp1

00254 def receive(self, tcb, from_, to):
00255     """receive packet for this socket
00256     This method must handle timmers"""
00257     (ip, tcp) = (None, None)
00258     while 1: 
00259         reply = tcb.output[ from_ ].read()
00260         try: 
00261             packet = ethernet.ethernet(reply)
00262             ip = packet.data
00263             tcp = ip.data
00264             if (tcb.ip[ from_ ]==ip.dst and \
00265                 tcb.ip[ to ]==ip.src and \
00266                 tcb.tcpport[ from_ ]==tcp.dport and \
00267                 tcb.tcpport[ to ]==tcp.sport): 
00268                 break
00269         except: 
00270             print "packet ignored"
00271             pass
00272         
00273     return (ip, tcp)
00274

00276 def createethernet(self, tcb, from_, to):
00277     """Create ethernet header"""
00278     ether1 = ethernet.ethernet()
00279     ether1.src = tcb.ether[ from_ ]
00280     ether1.dst = tcb.ether[ to ]                
00281     ether1.type = 0x800
00282     
00283     return ether1
00284     
00285 
00286 def createwritepacket(self, tcb, ip, tcp, from_, to):
00287     ether = createethernet(self, tcb, from_, to)
00288     
00289     tcp.checksum = tcp_cksum(tcp , ip) 
00290 
00291     ip.length = len(ip.bytes) + len(tcp.bytes) 
00292     ip.checksum = ip_cksum(ip)
00293  
00294     packet = pcs.Chain([ ether, ip, tcp ])
00295     tcb.output[ from_ ].write(packet.bytes, len(packet.bytes))
00296

00298 def tcp_cksum(self, ip, data = ""):  #TODO: add this method to pcs tcp.py
00299     """return tcpv4 checksum"""
00300     import struct
00301     total = 0
00302     
00303     tmpip = ipv4.pseudoipv4()
00304     tmpip.src = ip.src
00305     tmpip.dst = ip.dst
00306     tmpip.reserved = 0 
00307     tmpip.protocol = pcs.IPPROTO_TCP
00308     tmpip.length = len(self.getbytes()) + len(data)
00309     pkt = tmpip.getbytes() + self.getbytes() + data
00310     if len(pkt) % 2 == 1:
00311         pkt += "\0"
00312     for i in range(len(pkt)/2):
00313         total += (struct.unpack("!H", pkt[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00314     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00315     total += total >> 16
00316     return  ~total & 0xffff
00317     
00318 
00319 def ip_cksum(ip):    #TODO: solve the self problem, may be adding another arg
00320     """calculate the IPv4 checksum over a packet
00321     
00322     returns the calculated checksum
00323     """
00324     import struct
00325     total = 0
00326     packet = ipv4.ipv4(ip.bytes)
00327     packet.checksum = 0
00328     bytes = packet.bytes
00329     
00330     if len(bytes) % 2 == 1:
00331         bytes += "\0"
00332       
00333     for i in range(len(bytes)/2):
00334         total += (struct.unpack("!H", bytes[2*i:2*i+2])[0])
00335     
00336     total = (total >> 16) + (total & 0xffff)
00337     total += total >> 16
00338      
00339     return ~total & 0xffff

00342 def threewayhandshakenoopt(self, tcb, from_, to):    
00343 
00344     # 
00345     #--->Sending SYN
00346     (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = createsyn(self, tcb, from_, to)
00347     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, from_, to)
00348                                                            
00349     # 
00350     #--->Receivinig SYN + ACK
00351     (ipsynack, tcpsynack) = receive(self, tcb, from_, to) 
00352                                
00353     #Some blackmagic to use assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK at SYN
00354     tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] = tcpsynack.sequence  
00355     assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcpsynack, from_, to)
00356     assertSynPresent(self, tcpsynack)
00357     tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] = tcpsynack.sequence + 1
00358 
00359     #
00360     #-->Sending ACK
00361     (ipack, tcpack) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00362     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipack, tcpack, from_, to)
00363 
00364 
00365 def closeconnection(self, tcb, from_, to):    
00366 
00367     #
00368     #--->Sending FIN
00369     (ipfin, tcpfin) = createfin(self, tcb, from_, to)
00370     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, from_, to)
00371                                                            
00372     #
00373     #--->Receiving ACK from FIN sent
00374     (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, tcb, from_, to) 
00375     assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcpfinack, from_, to)
00376 
00377     #
00378     #--->Receiving FIN
00379     #test if FIN was sent in the same segment
00380     if (tcpfinack.fin == None or tcpfinack.fin == 0):
00381         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, tcb, from_, to)
00382         assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcpfinack, from_, to)
00383         
00384     assertFin(self, tcpfinack)
00385     tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] += 1
00386              
00387     #
00388     #--->Sending ACK
00389     (ipackfin, tcpackfin) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00390     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipackfin, tcpackfin, from_, to)
00391                 
00392 
00393 
00394 def passivecloseconnection(self, tcb, from_, to):    
00395 
00396     #
00397     #--->Receiving FIN
00398     (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, tcb, from_, to)
00399     assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcpfinack, from_, to)
00400     assertFin(self, tcpfinack)
00401     tcb.tcpsequence[ to ] += 1
00402              
00403     #
00404     #--->Sending ACK
00405     (ipackfin, tcpackfin) = createip(self, tcb, from_, to)
00406     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipackfin, tcpackfin, from_, to)
00407                 
00408     #
00409     #--->Sending FIN
00410     (ipfin, tcpfin) = createfin(self, tcb, from_, to)
00411     createwritepacket(self, tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, from_, to)
00412                                                            
00413     #
00414     #--->Receiving ACK from FIN sent
00415     (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = receive(self, tcb, from_, to) 
00416     assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, tcb, tcpfinack, from_, to)

00422        self.ipid = { }
00423        self.tcpport = { }
00424        self.tcpsequence = { }
00425        self.ether = { }
00426        self.output = { }
00427        self.conversation = None

00429     def __str__(self):
00430        retval=""
00431        
00432        retval+="ip = "+self.ip.__str__()+"\n"
00433        retval+="ipid = "+self.ipid.__str__()+"\n"
00434        retval+="tcpport = "+self.tcpport.__str__()+"\n"
00435        retval+="tcpsequence = "+self.tcpsequence.__str__()+"\n"
00436        retval+="pether = "+self.ether.__str__()+"\n"
00437        retval+="output = "+self.output.__str__()+"\n"
00438        #retval+="conversation = "+self.conversation
00439        
00440        return retval
